Cluster cell counts per sample

Source: R/clusterCellCountsPerSample-methods.R
clusterCellCountsPerSample.Rd

Cluster cell counts per sample

clusterCellCountsPerSample(object, ...)

# S4 method for SingleCellExperiment
clusterCellCountsPerSample(object)

# S4 method for Seurat
clusterCellCountsPerSample(object)

# S4 method for cell_data_set
clusterCellCountsPerSample(object)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments.

Value

grouped_df. Grouped by sampleName column, arranged by abundance.

Note

Updated 2019-09-03.

Examples

data(
    Seurat,
    cell_data_set,
    package = "acidtest"
)

## Seurat ====
object <- Seurat
colData(object)[["sampleID"]] <- as.factor(paste0("sample", seq(2L)))
colData(object)[["sampleName"]] <- colData(object)[["sampleID"]]
x <- clusterCellCountsPerSample(object)
print(x)
#> DataFrame with 6 rows and 5 columns
#>      ident sampleName         n nPerIdent             ratio
#>   <factor>   <factor> <integer> <integer>         <numeric>
#> 1        0    sample1        19        36 0.527777777777778
#> 2        0    sample2        17        36 0.472222222222222
#> 3        1    sample1        11        25              0.44
#> 4        1    sample2        14        25              0.56
#> 5        2    sample1        10        19 0.526315789473684
#> 6        2    sample2         9        19 0.473684210526316

## cell_data_set ====
object <- cell_data_set
x <- clusterCellCountsPerSample(object)
print(x)
#> DataFrame with 4 rows and 5 columns
#>      ident sampleName         n nPerIdent     ratio
#>   <factor>   <factor> <integer> <integer> <numeric>
#> 1        1    unknown        81        81         1
#> 2        2    unknown        57        57         1
#> 3        3    unknown        35        35         1
#> 4        4    unknown        27        27         1
